alert.note: Alert for Coastal York; Interior York (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 5:57PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central York County through 645 PM EDT... At 557 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Berwick, or 8 miles southwest of Sanford, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Biddeford, Alfred, Sanford, Saco, Somersworth, Kennebunk, Berwick, Lebanon, Kennebunkport, Old Orchard Beach, Wells, South Berwick, Lyman, Arundel, North Berwick, and Dayton. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 17 and 38. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southwestern Maine...and central New Hampshire.
